reviews.review: Nice game. If you like puzzles, this is the game for you. Unless you are a master at them, then don't waste your time on this game.
The puzzles are really fun and challenging.

Simple but fun gameplay. If you liked the first one you'll like this one.

The Portal franchise started when Valve picked up a student game design team's final project and made it into a bonus feature of sorts for the orange box. Portal 1 eventually became one of the most beloved games of all time, and for it's sequel, that team was given a way higher budget and [b]BOY CAN YOU TELL.[/b] Portal 2  is truly, unironically the only game I can call perfect. I have played through it's campaign more times than I can count, and thoroughly enjoying the experience each individual time. The co-op mode is also incredibly fun (if not a bit of a friendship destroyer lol), the community made test chambers bring thousands of hours worth of new content to it, and [b] that [i]SOUNDTRACK[/i][/b]. Truly a must-play. If someone made me validate videogames as an art form, I'd just show them this absolute masterpiece.
